page.title: 15FISHING BY THE THAMES
page.content: The fishing rights on the Eton side of the Thames from the Master's boat-house to lower Clewer village belong to Eton College.We talked to a river-baillif from the college. Permits cost Â£5 a year or 50p a day and help to check how many people are fishing .Even College boys need them There are pike,tench,perch, gudgeon and rudd in the river.The baillif had seen a seventeen pound pike landed at the little weir In 1980 they stocked the pond with 50 tench,50cms long. There are five baillifs responsible for security and fishing.There are many small streams running into the river at Eton.The baillifs patrol the college grounds.One night vandals damaged 15 trees.Another night the goalposts were broken.People often leave fishing gear by the bank and the baillif takes it in.
